title: How People With Disabilities Saw Fetterman’s Debate Performance
description: One in four Americans has a disability, but disabled politicians are rarely on the national debate stage. That made John Fetterman’s appearance a powerful moment, but public reactions were painful.
dc:creator: Maggie Astor

media:content.media:description: Preparations for Tuesday’s Senate debate in Pennsylvania. Lt. Gov. John Fetterman faced his Republican opponent, Dr. Mehmet Oz, months after a stroke left Mr. Fetterman with an auditory processing disorder.
